citation.article-title: Thiohalomonas denitrificans gen. nov., sp. nov. and Thiohalomonas nitratireducens sp. nov., novel obligately chemolithoautotrophic, moderately halophilic, thiodenitrifying Gammaproteobacteria from hypersaline habitats
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Thiohalomonas [Thi.o.ha.lo.moâ€²nas. Gr. n. thion sulfur; Gr. n. hals, halos salt; Gr. n. monas a unit, monad; N.L. fem. n. Thiohalomonas salt (-tolerant), sulfur-utilizing monad].
Cells are non-motile rods or vibrios with a Gram-negative cell wall.
Utilizes reduced sulfur compounds as electron donors with oxygen or nitrate as electron acceptors.
Habitat is hypersaline lakes and salterns.
